item.title: 韩国法院命令日本赔偿“慰安妇”，推翻了先前的裁决
item.description:
A South Korean appellate court on Thursday ordered Japan to compensate a group of 16 women who were forced to work in Japanese wartime brothels, overturning a lower court ruling that dismissed the case.翻译:韩国一家上诉法院周四下令日本对被迫在日本战时妓院工作的 16 名女性进行赔偿，推翻了下级法院驳回此案的裁决。

The legacy of Japan's 1910-45 colonial rule of the Korean peninsula remains politically sensitive for both sides, with many surviving "comfort women" - a Japanese euphemism for the sex abuse victims - still demanding Tokyo's formal apology and compensation.翻译:日本 1910-45 年对朝鲜半岛的殖民统治的遗产对双方来说仍然具有政治敏感性，许多幸存的“慰安妇”（日本对性虐待受害者的委婉说法）仍然要求东京正式道歉和赔偿。

Bilateral relations between the two U.S. allies have been strained for years by the issues of wartime sex abuse and forced labour, but South Korea's President Yoon Suk Yeol and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida have sought to improve ties.翻译:多年来，由于战时性虐待和强迫劳动问题，这两个美国盟友之间的双边关系一直紧张，但韩国总统尹锡烈和日本首相岸田文雄一直在寻求改善关系。

The 16 victims filed the suit in 2016, seeking 200 million won ($155,000) each in compensation. But the Seoul Central District Court dismissed the case in 2021, citing sovereign immunity, a legal doctrine that allows a state to be exempt from a civil suit in foreign courts.翻译:16 名受害者于 2016 年提起诉讼，要求每人赔偿 2 亿韩元（155,000 美元）。但首尔中央地方法院于 2021 年驳回了此案，理由是主权豁免，这是一项允许国家免受外国法院民事诉讼的法律原则。

The Seoul High Court, however, reversed the lower court's decision, recognising the jurisdiction of South Korean courts over the Japanese government as a defendant.翻译:然而，首尔高等法院推翻了下级法院的判决，承认韩国法院对作为被告的日本政府的管辖权。

"It is reasonable to consider that there is a common international law which does not recognise state immunity for an illegal act ... regardless of whether the act was a sovereign act," the appellate court said in a statement.翻译:上诉法院在一份声明中表示：“有理由认为，存在一项不承认非法行为的国家豁免权的共同国际法……无论该行为是否是主权行为。”

The court also said the case falls within South Korea's jurisdiction as the plaintiffs live in the country and sought compensation over the acts that are deemed "unlawful" under its civil law.翻译:法院还表示，该案属于韩国管辖范围，因为原告居住在韩国，并就其民法中被视为“非法”的行为寻求赔偿。

Tokyo has said the issue was settled under a 1965 treaty that normalised diplomatic relations, and the two neighbours agreed to "irreversibly" end the dispute in a 2015 deal.翻译:东京表示，这一问题已根据 1965 年外交关系正常化条约得到解决，两个邻国同意在 2015 年达成的协议中“不可逆转地”结束争端。

In a statement, Japanese Foreign Minister Yoko Kamikawa said the judgment went against international law and agreements between the two countries, calling it "extremely regrettable and absolutely unacceptable."翻译:日本外务大臣上川洋子在一份声明中表示，这一判决违反了国际法和两国之间的协议，称其“极其令人遗憾和绝对不可接受”。

"Japan once again strongly urges the Republic of Korea to immediately take appropriate measures to remedy the status of its breaches of international law," she said.翻译:她说：“日本再次强烈敦促韩国立即采取适当措施，纠正其违反国际法的行为。”

South Korea's foreign ministry said it was looking into details of the latest ruling, without elaborating.翻译:韩国外交部表示正在调查最新裁决的细节，但没有详细说明。

Lee Yong-soo, a 95-year-old activist and victim who also filed the suit, welcomed the decision and tearfully thanked the court for the decision.翻译:同样提起诉讼的 95 岁活动人士兼受害者李龙洙 (Lee Yong-soo) 对这一判决表示欢迎，并含泪感谢法院的判决。

"I'm grateful. I'm really grateful," she said as she exited the courthouse, adding that she wished she was able to share the news and gratitude with some other victims who had passed away.翻译:“我很感激。我真的很感激，”她离开法院时说道，并补充说她希望能够与其他一些去世的受害者分享这个消息和感激之情。

($1 = 1,294.3500 won)翻译:(1 美元 = 1,294.3500 韩元)

Reporting by Hyonhee Shin; Additional reporting by Chang-Ran Kim and Makiko Yamazaki in Tokyo; Editing by Ed Davies, Simon Cameron-Moore and Sharon Singleton翻译:申贤熙报道； Chang-Ran Kim 和 Makiko Yamazaki 在东京的补充报道；编辑：艾德·戴维斯、西蒙·卡梅伦-摩尔和莎朗·辛格尔顿

item.title: 世卫组织要求中国提供呼吸道疾病疫情的详细信息
item.description:
The World Health Organization (WHO) has asked China for details on an increase in respiratory illnesses and reported clusters of pneumonia in children, which its China office on Thursday called a "routine" check.翻译:世界卫生组织（WHO）已要求中国提供有关呼吸道疾病增加的详细信息，并报告了儿童聚集性肺炎的情况，其中国办事处周四称这是“例行”检查。

Chinese authorities from the National Health Commission held a press conference on Nov. 13 to report an increase in incidence of respiratory disease.翻译:11月13日，国家卫健委召开新闻发布会，通报呼吸道疾病发病率上升情况。

Authorities attributed the increase to the lifting of COVID-19 restrictions and the circulation of known pathogens such as influenza, mycoplasma pneumoniae, a common bacterial infection that typically affects younger children, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), and the virus that causes COVID-19.翻译:当局将感染人数增加归因于取消了 COVID-19 限制以及已知病原体的传播，例如流感、肺炎支原体（一种通常影响幼儿的常见细菌感染）、呼吸道合胞病毒 (RSV) 以及导致 COVID-19 的病毒。

Both China and the WHO have faced questions about the transparency of reporting on the earliest COVID-19 cases that emerged in the central Chinese city of Wuhan in late 2019.翻译:中国和世界卫生组织都面临着关于 2019 年底在中国中部城市武汉出现的最早的 COVID-19 病例报告透明度的质疑。

On Wednesday, the WHO said groups including the Program for Monitoring Emerging Diseases (ProMED) reported clusters of undiagnosed pneumonia in children in north China. The WHO said it was not clear if these were associated with an overall increase in respiratory infections previously reported by Chinese authorities or separate events.翻译:周三，世界卫生组织表示，包括新发疾病监测计划（ProMED）在内的组织报告称，中国北方儿童出现了多起未确诊肺炎病例。世界卫生组织表示，尚不清楚这些是否与中国当局此前报告的呼吸道感染总体增加或单独事件有关。

The WHO said it had asked for additional epidemiologic and clinical information as well as laboratory results from the reported outbreaks among children, through the International Health Regulations mechanism.翻译:世界卫生组织表示，已通过《国际卫生条例》机制要求提供更多的流行病学和临床信息以及所报告的儿童疫情的实验室结果。

Under the rules, China is supposed to respond to WHO within 24 hours.翻译:根据规定，中国应在24小时内对世卫组织做出回应。

The U.N. health agency has also asked China for further information about trends in the circulation of known pathogens and the burden on health-care systems. The WHO said it was in contact with clinicians and scientists through its existing technical partnerships and networks in China.翻译:联合国卫生机构还要求中国提供有关已知病原体传播趋势和卫生保健系统负担的进一步信息。世界卫生组织表示，它正在通过其在中国现有的技术合作伙伴关系和网络与临床医生和科学家保持联系。

WHO China said it was "routine" to request information on increases in respiratory illnesses and reported clusters of pneumonia in children from member states, such as China.翻译:世界卫生组织驻华代表处表示，向中国等成员国索取有关呼吸道疾病增加情况和报告的儿童聚集性肺炎的信息是“例行公事”。

The global agency decided to issue a statement on China to share available information, as it received a number of queries about it from media, WHO China said in an emailed statement.翻译:世界卫生组织驻华代表处在一份电子邮件声明中表示，由于收到媒体的一些询问，该全球机构决定发表一份关于中国的声明，以分享现有信息。

The ProMED alert was based on a report by FTV News in Taiwan that came out on Tuesday.翻译:ProMED 警报是基于台湾 FTV News 周二发布的一篇报道。

Undiagnosed pneumonia was not mentioned at last week's press conference, according to a transcript, but one speaker said everyone felt like there had been an increase in respiratory illnesses this year compared with three years ago.翻译:根据一份文字记录，上周的新闻发布会上没有提到未确诊的肺炎，但一位发言者表示，每个人都觉得今年的呼吸道疾病与三年前相比有所增加。

The speaker said that global monitoring for mycoplasma pneumoniae had been at a low over the past three years and outbreaks were cyclical, occurring every three to seven years.

'SEASONAL SURGE'

The rise in respiratory illnesses comes as China braces for its first full winter season since it had lifted strict COVID-19 restrictions in December. Many other countries saw similar increases in respiratory diseases after easing pandemic measures.翻译:呼吸道疾病的增加正值中国准备迎接自去年 12 月取消严格的 COVID-19 限制以来的第一个完整冬季。在放松大流行措施后，许多其他国家的呼吸道疾病也出现了类似的增加。

"It is just a relatively large seasonal surge, perhaps partly due to chance and partly because there's a bit of 'immunity debt' from the lesser winter surges in the last three years," said Ben Cowling, an epidemiologist at Hong Kong University.翻译:香港大学流行病学家本·考林表示：“这只是一次相对较大的季节性激增，可能部分是偶然，部分是因为过去三年冬季疫情较少，造成了一些‘免疫债’。”

China's National Health Commission did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:中国国家卫生健康委员会没有立即回应置评请求。

On Thursday, it published an interview with the state media agency Xinhua in which it advised parents what to do and mentioned that big hospitals were receiving a large number of patients and waiting times were long. It did not comment on the WHO notice.翻译:周四，它发表了接受官方媒体新华社的采访，其中建议家长该怎么做，并提到大医院接收大量患者，等待时间很长。它没有对世界卫生组织的通知发表评论。

Since mid-October, the WHO said northern China had reported an increase in influenza-like illness compared with the same period in the previous three years.翻译:自10月中旬以来，世界卫生组织表示，与前三年同期相比，中国北方报告的流感样疾病有所增加。

It said China had systems in place to capture information on trends in illness incidence and to report that data to platforms such as the Global Influenza Surveillance and Response System.翻译:报告称，中国已建立系统来获取有关疾病发病率趋势的信息，并将这些数据报告给全球流感监测和应对系统等平台。

In recent days, media in cities such as Xian in the northwest have posted videos of hospitals crowded with parents and children awaiting checks.翻译:最近几天，西北西安等城市的媒体发布了医院挤满家长和孩子等待检查的视频。

Some social media users have posted photos of children doing homework while receiving intravenous drips in hospital.翻译:一些社交媒体用户发布了孩子们在医院接受静脉滴注时做作业的照片。

The WHO said that while it was seeking additional information, it recommended that people in China follow measures to reduce the risk of respiratory illness.翻译:世界卫生组织表示，在寻求更多信息的同时，建议中国民众采取措施降低呼吸道疾病的风险。

Measures included vaccination, keeping distance from sick people, staying at home when ill, getting tested and medical care as needed, wearing masks as appropriate, ensuring good ventilation, and regular hand-washing, it said.翻译:报告称，措施包括接种疫苗、与病人保持距离、生病时待在家里、根据需要接受检测和医疗护理、适当佩戴口罩、确保良好的通风和定期洗手。

Reporting By Deena Beasley in Los Angeles, Andrew Silver in Shanghai, Jennifer Rigby in London and Emma Farge in Geneva; Editing by Robert Birsel, Miyoung Kim翻译:洛杉矶的 Deena Beasley、上海的 Andrew Silver、伦敦的 Jennifer Rigby 和日内瓦的 Emma Farge 报道；责任编辑：Robert Birsel、Miyoung Kim

item.title: 数据显示，苹果双十一销量不及华为、小米
item.description:
Apple (AAPL.O) saw a decline in the number of smartphones sold during China's recent Singles Day shopping festival, data from Counterpoint Research showed, lagging domestic rivals Huawei and Xiaomi which recorded robust increases.翻译:Counterpoint Research 的数据显示，苹果(AAPL.O)在中国最近的双十一购物节期间智能手机销量有所下降，落后于国内竞争对手华为和小米的强劲增长。

The number of Apple smartphones sold declined 4% year-on-year during the two-week sales from Oct.r 30 to Nov. 12, the research consultancy said on Thursday. In comparison, the number of units sold by Huawei (HWT.UL) and Xiaomi (1810.HK) grew 66% and 28% respectively year-on-year over the same period.翻译:该研究咨询公司周四表示，从 10 月 30 日到 11 月 12 日的两周销售期间，苹果智能手机销量同比下降了 4%。相比之下，华为（HWT.UL）和小米（1810.HK）的销量同比分别增长66%和28%。

The increases for Huawei and Xiaomi helped fuel a 5% year-over-year rise in the overall number of Chinese smartphones sold during the promotion period, it said.翻译:华为和小米的销量增长推动了促销期间中国智能手机总销量同比增长 5%。

The price for Apple's latest iPhone 15 model starts at 5,999 yuan ($832), while Huawei's Mate 60 smartphones start from 5,499 yuan ($763). Xiaomi's latest Mi 14 smartphone is priced from 3,999 yuan ($555).翻译:苹果最新款 iPhone 15 起价为 5,999 元（832 美元），而华为 Mate 60 智能手机起价为 5,499 元（763 美元）。小米最新的 Mi 14 智能手机售价 3,999 元（555 美元）起。

Huawei, Apple and Xiaomi did not immediately respond to requests for comment.翻译:华为、苹果和小米没有立即回应置评请求。

China's e-commerce platforms such as Alibaba (9988.HK) and JD.com (9618.HK) did not release sales figures for the Singles Day festival, having dropped the practice last year, although JD.com said the value of transaction volume of Apple products surpassed 10 billion yuan ($1.39 billion) on its platform during the period.翻译:阿里巴巴（9988.HK）和京东（9618.HK）等中国电商平台去年放弃了这种做法， 没有公布双十一的销售数据，尽管京东表示交易量的价值在此期间，苹果产品在其平台上的销售额超过 100 亿元人民币（13.9 亿美元）。

Analysts have said the Chinese smartphone market is poised to rebound, with research firm IDC saying it expects sales to grow year-on-year in the fourth quarter after ten consecutive quarters of falling shipments.翻译:分析师表示，中国智能手机市场即将反弹，研究公司IDC表示，在连续十个季度出货量下降后，预计第四季度销量将同比增长。

Competition between smartphone models ratcheted up before the annual shopping gala, with major Chinese e-commerce platforms offering significant discounts on Apple's iPhones during the sales period.翻译:年度购物盛会前，智能手机型号之间的竞争加剧，中国各大电商平台在销售期间对苹果 iPhone 推出大幅折扣。

Apple released its iPhone 15 series in late September, roughly a month after Huawei launched the Mate 60 smartphone line powered by Huawei's independently developed advanced chip.翻译:苹果于 9 月下旬发布了 iPhone 15 系列，大约一个月前，华为推出了采用华为自主开发的先进芯片的 Mate 60 智能手机系列。

The Mate 60 series has received significant patriotic support in China with fans saying it shows how Huawei has managed to overcome years of export controls by the United States that initially crippled its smartphone business.翻译:Mate 60系列在中国获得了大力的爱国支持，粉丝们表示，这表明华为如何成功克服美国多年来的出口管制，这些管制最初削弱了其智能手机业务。

Xiaomi launched its flagship Mi 14 smartphone series in late October, with CEO Lei Jun revealing that sales for the new line had surpassed 1 million units after its release.翻译:小米于10月下旬推出了旗舰智能手机Mi 14系列，首席执行官雷军透露，新产品线发布后销量已突破100万台。

In addition to facing competition from domestic rivals, Counterpoint analysts attributed Apple's sluggish performance to supply chain issues that have constrained the availability of its new iPhone 15 models.翻译:除了面临国内竞争对手的竞争外，Counterpoint 分析师还将苹果业绩低迷归因于供应链问题，这些问题限制了其新款 iPhone 15 机型的供货。

"Apple is improving compared to last month but there still seems to be hiccups in terms of supply," said Ivan Lam, senior analyst for manufacturing at Counterpoint, adding that he expects the situation to normalize soon.翻译:Counterpoint 制造业高级分析师伊万·林 (Ivan Lam) 表示：“与上个月相比，苹果的情况有所改善，但供应方面似乎仍然存在问题。”他补充说，他预计情况很快就会恢复正常。

($1 = 7.2111 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2111 人民币）

item.title: 股市维持 11 月主导地位，石油受到 OPEC 疑虑打击
item.description:
Summary:
  • Euro boosted by forecast-beating PMI data, ECB minutes due later
  • World stocks on course for best month since COVID vaccine boost
  • Europe digesting far right election win in Holland
  • Oil slips after OPEC+ postponement
  • U.S. stock markets closed for Thanksgiving
翻译:概括：
  • PMI数据好于预期，欧洲央行会议纪要稍后公布，欧元提振
  • 全球股市有望创下自新冠疫苗接种以来表现最好的一个月
  • 欧洲消化极右翼荷兰大选胜利
  • OPEC+推迟后油价下跌
  • 美国股市因感恩节休市

World shares inched closer to their best month since the COVID vaccine breakthroughs of late 2020 on Thursday as Europe digested another far-right election shock and oil dipped after OPEC+ postponed its weekend meeting.翻译:周四，世界股市小幅接近自 2020 年底新冠疫苗取得突破以来的最佳月份水平，欧洲消化了另一场极右翼选举冲击，并且 OPEC+ 推迟周末会议后油价下跌。

Traders were getting their moves in before the annual U.S. Thanksgiving holiday scythes volumes later but there was plenty to keep them busy while they did it.翻译:交易员们在一年一度的美国感恩节假期之前开始行动，随后成交量大增，但在他们行动的同时，还有很多事情让他们忙碌。

Slightly stronger than expected German and French inflation data nudged the euro and bond yields higher, Sweden's crown dropped as its central bank left rates on hold while Dutch bank stocks fell after anti-EU far-right populist Geert Wilders scored a huge election win.翻译:略强于预期的德国和法国通胀数据推动欧元和债券收益率走高，瑞典克朗因央行维持利率不变而下跌，而反欧盟极右翼民粹主义者吉尔特·维尔德斯(Geert Wilders)在选举中取得巨大胜利后，荷兰银行股下跌。

The PMI in Germany beat expectations but was "not enough to say we have turned the corner on the economy," said Close Brothers Asset Management chief investment officer Robert Alster, adding that activity had still contracted.翻译:Close Brothers Asset Management 首席投资官罗伯特·阿尔斯特 (Robert Alster) 表示，德国的 PMI 超出预期，但“还不足以表明我们已经扭转经济困境”，并补充称经济活动仍处于收缩状态。

"Holland is genuine surprise as a win for the right, but I suspect the market will wait to see what happens in terms of a coalition."翻译:“荷兰作为右翼的胜利确实令人惊讶，但我怀疑市场会等着看联盟方面会发生什么。”

A fan of Hungary's eurosceptic Prime Minister Viktor Orban, the vocally anti-Islam Wilders has vowed to halt all immigration, slash Dutch payments to the European Union and block the entrance of any new members, including Ukraine.翻译:威尔德斯是匈牙利疑欧派总理欧尔班维克托的粉丝，公开反对伊斯兰教，他发誓要停止所有移民，削减荷兰向欧盟的付款，并阻止包括乌克兰在内的任何新成员国进入。

Beating all predictions, his Freedom Party (PVV) won 37 seats out of 150, well ahead of 25 for a joint Labour/Green ticket and 24 for the conservative People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD) of outgoing Prime Minister Mark Rutte.

ECB MINUTES IN FOCUS

For traders, the next thing to watch will be the minutes of the European Central Bank's most recent meeting and a interest rate decision in Turkey where the central bank is expected to maintain its rapid run of interest rate hikes翻译:对于交易员来说，接下来值得关注的将是欧洲央行最近的会议纪要以及土耳其的利率决定，预计该央行将维持快速加息。

In Asia, the focus was on China where there were more signs of support for the long-suffering property market.翻译:在亚洲，焦点集中在中国，那里有更多迹象表明长期低迷的房地产市场得到了支持。

MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan (.MIAPJ0000PUS) ended little changed in thin trading, with Japan also on holiday, although Chinese real estate stocks (..CSI000952) jumped 3% on reports debt-laden Country Garden (2007.HK) would be on a list of developers getting support.翻译:MSCI 日本以外最广泛的亚太股票指数(.MIAPJ0000PUS)在清淡的交易中收盘几乎没有变化，日本也在假期，尽管中国房地产股票(..CSI000952)因报告负债累累的碧桂园(2007.香港）将出现在获得支持的开发商名单上。

Meanwhile, a large wealth manager with heavy exposure to the property market disclosed that it faces insolvency with relevant liabilities of up to $64 billion.翻译:与此同时，一家涉足房​​地产市场的大型财富管理公司透露，该公司面临破产，相关负债高达640亿美元。

Chinese government advisers will recommend to an annual policymakers' meeting that economic growth targets for next year be set at 4.5% to 5.5%, Reuters had reported on Wednesday.翻译:据路透社周三报道，中国政府顾问将向年度决策者会议建议将明年的经济增长目标设定在 4.5% 至 5.5%。

Wall Street's benchmark S&P 500 (.SPX) is nearing a fresh high for 2023, with the S&P 500 and MSCI's all-country world index (.MIWD00000PUS) both up more than 8% this month alone. For MSCI world that is the best showing since November 2020 when markets got a major shot in the arm from COVID vaccine hopes.翻译:华尔街基准标准普尔 500 指数(.SPX)接近 2023 年新高，仅本月标准普尔 500 指数和 MSCI 全国世界指数(.MIWD00000PUS)均上涨超过 8%。对于 MSCI 世界来说，这是自 2020 年 11 月以来最好的表现，当时市场因新冠疫苗的希望而受到一剂强心剂。

Germany's 10-year bund , the benchmark for the Europe, was fractionally higher on the day at 2.57% having touched 3% last month. Ten-year U.S. Treasury yields were little changed at 4.4%.翻译:作为欧洲基准的德国10年期国债当天小幅上涨至2.57%，上个月触及3%。十年期美国国债收益率几乎没有变化，为 4.4%。

The euro's bounce pushed the dollar index back down towards a 2-1/2 month low having moved away from it on Wednesday after the number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell more than expected.翻译:周三美国初请失业金人数降幅超过预期后，欧元反弹推动美元指数回落至 2-1/2 个月低点。

Sterling also recovered from a knock it had taken on Wednesday when UK Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt unveiled a string of tax cuts in his autumn budget, but also forecast a far more sluggish economic outlook than previously expected.翻译:英镑也从周三受到的打击中恢复过来，当时英国财政部长杰里米·亨特在其秋季预算中公布了一系列减税措施，但他也预测经济前景比之前预期的要低得多。

In commodity markets, news that OPEC+ postponed a weekend meeting sent both Brent and U.S. WTI down 1.4% to $80.70 and $76.03 per barrel on expectations it might see the group cut output less than anticipated.翻译:大宗商品市场方面， OPEC+ 推迟周末会议的消息导致布伦特原油和美国 WTI 均下跌 1.4%，至每桶 80.70 美元和 76.03 美元，因市场预期该组织减产幅度可能低于预期。

In cryptocurrencies, buyers were still digesting the news of Binance chief Changpeng Zhao stepping down and pleading guilty to violations of U.S. anti-money laundering laws as part of a $4 billion settlement.翻译:在加密货币方面，作为 40 亿美元和解协议的一部分，币安首席执行官赵长鹏辞职并承认违反美国反洗钱法的罪行，买家仍在消化这一消息。

Bitcoin fell by 0.77% on Thursday to $37,337 after it rose nearly 5% on Wednesday.翻译:比特币在周三上涨近 5% 后，周四下跌 0.77% 至 37,337 美元。

item.title: 中国称菲律宾利用外国势力在南海制造事端
item.description:
Summary:
  • China vows to defend its maritime rights, interests
  • Chinese navy shadowed joint patrol warships - Philippine military chief
  • Philippines has pursued warmer relations with U.S.
翻译:概括：
  • 中国誓言捍卫海洋权益
  • 中国海军跟踪菲律宾联合巡逻舰
  • 菲律宾寻求改善与美国的关系

The Philippines has enlisted "foreign forces" to patrol the South China Sea and has been stirring up trouble, China's military said on Thursday, referring to joint patrols this week by Philippine and U.S. forces.翻译:中国军方周四表示，菲律宾招募“外国军队”在南海巡逻，并不断滋事，指的是菲律宾和美国军队本周的联合巡逻。

The Chinese military will maintain high vigilance, resolutely defend sovereignty and maritime rights and interests, and resolutely safeguard peace and stability in the South China Sea, China's military said.翻译:中国军队将保持高度警惕，坚决捍卫主权和海洋权益，坚决维护南海和平稳定。

"The Philippines enlisted forces out of the region to patrol ... stirred up trouble and engaged in hype, undermining regional peace and stability," the southern theatre command of the Chinese military said.翻译:中国军队南部战区表示，菲律宾派兵出境巡逻……挑衅炒作，破坏地区和平稳定。

Philippine officials have said their military and the U.S. launched joint patrols on Tuesday in waters near Taiwan, a democratically governed island that China claims as its own, raising the possibility of further tensions with China.翻译:菲律宾官员表示，菲律宾军方和美国周二在台湾附近海域进行联合巡逻，中国宣称拥有台湾主权，这增加了与中国进一步紧张关系的可能性。

Relations have soured between China and the Philippines over the South China Sea under Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr as he pivots towards closer ties with the U.S., which supports the Southeast Asian nation in its maritime disputes with China.翻译:在菲律宾总统小费迪南德·马科斯（Ferdinand Marcos Jr）领导下，随着美国支持这个东南亚国家与中国的海事争端，与美国建立更紧密的关系，中国和菲律宾之间的关系在南海问题上恶化。

A Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson said on Wednesday China had warned the U.S. and the Philippines in connection with their patrols.翻译:中国外交部发言人周三表示，中国已就美国和菲律宾的巡逻活动向其发出警告。

"China has made clear its position to the Philippines and the U.S. that the Philippine-U.S. joint patrols must not undermine China's territorial sovereignty and maritime rights and interests," spokesperson Mao Ning said.翻译:毛宁表示，中方已向菲方和美方表明立场，菲美联合巡逻不得损害中国领土主权和海洋权益。

A Chinese navy ship shadowed three U.S. and Philippine warships conducting joint patrols on Thursday, the Philippine armed forces chief, Romeo Brawner, told reporters.翻译:菲律宾武装部队司令罗密欧·布劳纳告诉记者，周四，一艘中国海军舰艇跟踪了正在进行联合巡逻的三艘美国和菲律宾军舰。

The incident occurred at around 10:15 a.m. near the platform of a natural gas field 27 nautical miles off Palawan province, Brawner said. "There was no challenge, no dangerous manoeuvres."翻译:布劳纳说，这起事件发生在上午 10 点 15 分左右，距离巴拉望省 27 海里的一个天然气田平台附近。 “没有任何挑战，没有危险的动作。”

The Philippines achieved its goal of closely operating with its ally, the United States, and there was no untoward incident, Brawner added.翻译:布劳纳补充说，菲律宾实现了与其盟友美国密切合作的目标，没有发生任何不愉快的事件。

The Philippine foreign ministry and the national security adviser's office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:菲律宾外交部和国家安全顾问办公室没有立即回应置评请求。

Reporting by Ella Cao, Bernard Orr and Liz Lee in Beijing, Neil Jerome Morales in Manila; Editing by Edmund Klamann, Robert Birsel翻译:Ella Cao、Bernard Orr 和 Liz Lee 在北京的报道，Neil Jerome Morales 在马尼拉的报道；编辑：埃德蒙·克拉曼、罗伯特·伯塞尔

item.title: 反对派竞选失败后，台湾执政党谈论对华政策
item.description:
Taiwan's ruling party outlined the need for talks to avoid conflict with China on Thursday, as the island's main opposition parties' campaign to win back power unravelled further on deep disagreement over who should run for president.翻译:台湾执政党周四概述了进行谈判以避免与中国发生冲突的必要性，因为台湾主要反对党夺回权力的运动因在谁应该竞选总统问题上存在深刻分歧而进一步瓦解。

China, which views Taiwan as its own territory despite the strong objections of the government in Taipei, looms large over the Jan. 13 poll especially as China has stepped up military pressure to assert its sovereignty claims.翻译:尽管台北政府强烈反对，中国仍将台湾视为自己的领土，在 1 月 13 日的民意调查中显得尤为突出，尤其是在中国加大军事压力以维护其主权主张的情况下。

The Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) this week announced Hsiao Bi-khim, previously Taiwan's high-profile de facto ambassador to the United states, as the running mate for its presidential candidate Lai Ching-te, the frontrunner to be the island's next leader.翻译:民进党（DPP）本周宣布，前台湾高调的事实上的驻美国大使萧美琴为其总统候选人赖清德的竞选伙伴，赖清德是台湾下一任领导人的领跑者。

While they registered their candidacy with the election office this week, ahead of a Friday afternoon deadline, Taiwan's two main opposition parties, along with Foxconn founder Terry Gou who is also bidding for the presidency, have yet to do so.翻译:虽然台湾的两个主要反对党以及富士康创始人郭台铭本周在周五下午的最后期限之前向选举办公室登记了自己的候选人资格，但他们尚未这样做。

The opposition Kuomintang (KMT) and Taiwan People's Party (TPP) had previously agreed to work together against the ruling DPP but have made no progress on plans for a united presidential ticket.翻译:反对党国民党和台湾人民党此前曾同意共同反对执政的民进党，但在统一总统选举的计划上没有取得任何进展。

Lai and Hsiao, on the other hand, with a united party behind them, are moving ahead smoothly with their campaign.翻译:另一方面，黎智英和萧在团结的政党支持下，竞选活动进展顺利。

Hsiao, speaking to international media, discussed the sanctions China has placed on her - Beijing believes both she and Lai are dangerous separatists - and the importance of dialogue.翻译:萧向国际媒体发表讲话，讨论了中国对她实施的制裁——北京认为她和黎智英都是危险的分裂分子——以及对话的重要性。

"We have reiterated our position that we remain open to dialogue, that we are also committed to the status quo," she said.翻译:她说：“我们重申了我们的立场，即我们对对话保持开放态度，我们也致力于维持现状。”

"It's also important that the international community, who also agrees with our position in continuing peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait, make clear to our counterparts across the Taiwan Strait that dialogue is the only way to resolve differences. War is not an option."

'OPPOSITION COLLABORATION'

Taiwan's largest opposition party, the KMT, which traditionally favours close ties with Beijing, had agreed to work with the much smaller TPP on a joint ticket for the election, but they have been unable to agree who should be the presidential candidate.翻译:台湾最大的反对党国民党传统上倾向于与北京保持密切关系，该党已同意与规模小得多的跨太平洋党合作联合竞选，但他们未能就谁应该成为总统候选人达成一致。

Their disagreement has gripped Taiwan for the past week, and both parties have insisted they still want to work together.翻译:过去一周，他们的分歧一直困扰着台湾，双方都坚称仍希望合作。

Gou, who stepped down as chairman of iPhone maker Foxconn (2317.TW) in 2019, has entered the fray, trying to broker an agreement between the KMT and TPP.翻译:郭台铭于 2019 年辞去 iPhone 制造商富士康(2317.TW)董事长一职，目前已加入这场竞争，试图促成国民党与 TPP 之间达成协议。

On Thursday afternoon, Gou and the TPP chairman and presidential candidate Ko Wen-je arrived at a Taipei hotel for talks with the KMT's Hou Yu-ih, who is expected to join them having initially declined to go.翻译:周四下午，郭台铭和TPP主席兼总统候选人柯文哲抵达台北一家酒店，与国民党侯友邑会谈，侯友邑最初拒绝前往，但预计他将与他们会面。

"What we want is fair and just three-way talks, to reach the aim of opposition collaboration and a change of power," Gou's spokesperson, Huang Shih-hsiu, told reporters.翻译:“我们想要的是公平公正的三方会谈，以达到反对派合作和权力更迭的目的，”郭台铭的发言人黄士修告诉记者。

It is not clear whether Gou, who has trailed in opinion polls, will formally register to run for presidency.翻译:目前尚不清楚在民意调查中一直落后的郭台铭是否会正式登记竞选总统。

At the Taipei hotel, Gou's campaign set up a digital clock counting down to Friday's election registration deadline of 0930 GMT.翻译:在台北酒店，郭台铭的竞选团队设置了一个数字时钟，对星期五的选举登记截止日期（格林威治标准时间 0930）进行倒计时。

"There's not much time left," Huang said. "We are here, waiting for Hou's presence."翻译:“剩下的时间不多了，”黄说。 “我们在这里，等待侯的到来。”

Reporting by Ben Blanchard; additional reporting by Yimou Lee and Sarah Wu; Editing by Jacqueline Wong and Robert Birsel翻译:本·布兰查德报道；李艺谋和吴莎拉的补充报道；编辑：Jacqueline Wong 和 Robert Birsel

item.title: 尼泊尔 TikTokers 谴责政府禁止应用程序，引发抗议和法院上诉
item.description:
Nepali TikTok creator Manjita Manandhar was caught off guard when the Himalayan nation banned the popular social media platform last week for disturbing "social harmony and goodwill".翻译:尼泊尔 TikTok 创始人曼吉塔·马南达尔 (Manjita Manandhar) 上周喜马拉雅国家以扰乱“社会和谐与善意”为由禁止这款流行的社交媒体平台，这让尼泊尔 TikTok 创始人曼吉塔·马南达尔 (Manjita Manandhar) 措手不及。

"I was shocked as the decision came suddenly," said Manandhar, who earns about $1,500 a month by making content for restaurants, hotels and brands, and posting them on the app.翻译:Manandhar 说：“这个决定来得突然，我感到很震惊。”他通过为餐馆、酒店和品牌制作内容并将其发布到应用程序上，每月赚取约 1,500 美元。

"Business has halved since the ban and the income from other social platforms like Instagram and YouTube is not enough to support this loss," she said. The 26-year-old splits her income with a videographer and a manager, who oversees communication with clients.翻译:“自禁令实施以来，业务量减少了一半，来自 Instagram 和 YouTube 等其他社交平台的收入不足以支撑这一损失，”她说。这位 26 岁的女士将收入分配给一名摄像师和一名负责与客户沟通的经理。

Nepal's centre-left coalition government is the latest to ban the app. TikTok is owned by China-based ByteDance, and several countries have raised concerns over its proximity to the Chinese government and hold over user data across the world.翻译:尼泊尔中左翼联合政府是最新 禁止该应用程序的政府。 TikTok 由中国字节跳动公司拥有， 多个国家对其与中国政府关系密切并掌握全球用户数据表示担忧。

Neighbour India banned TikTok along with dozens of other apps by Chinese developers in June 2020, saying that they could compromise national security and integrity.翻译:邻国印度于 2020 年 6 月禁止了 TikTok 以及中国开发商开发的数十款其他应用程序，称它们可能损害国家安全和诚信。

Many Nepalis, however, said the ban has cut off a source of income and shut down a forum for free speech.翻译:然而，许多尼泊尔人表示，该禁令切断了收入来源，并关闭了言论自由论坛。

Dozens of people held protests in Kathmandu demanding the government revoke the ban, while others filed petitions against it at the Supreme Court. The court has asked the government to provide, in writing, its reasons for the ban before a Dec. 5 hearing.翻译:数十人在加德满都举行抗议活动，要求政府撤销该禁令，而其他人则向最高法院提出反对该禁令的请愿书。法院已要求政府在 12 月 5 日的听证会之前以书面形式提供禁令的理由。

Rajib Subba, an expert on cyber security, said the ban had affected many people for whom the app was "a social medium of livelihood, creativity, innovation, entrepreneurship and advocacy". There are about 2.2 million TikTok users in Nepal, said Sudhir Parajuli, president of the Internet Service Providers' Association of Nepal (ISPAN).翻译:网络安全专家 Rajib Subba 表示，该禁令影响了许多人，对他们来说，该应用程序是“谋生、创造力、创新、创业和宣传的社交媒介”。尼泊尔互联网服务提供商协会 (ISPAN) 主席 Sudhir Parajuli 表示，尼泊尔约有 220 万 TikTok 用户。

In a letter to Nepal's telecom regulator, TikTok said it routinely addresses "content and behaviour" that violate its community guidelines. It did not provide any details.翻译:TikTok 在给尼泊尔电信监管机构的一封信中表示，它经常处理违反其社区准则的“内容和行为”。它没有提供任何细节。

More than 1,600 cyber crime cases, most of them related to TikTok, have been registered over the last four years in Nepal, according to local media reports.翻译:据当地媒体报道，过去四年尼泊尔共登记了 1,600 多起网络犯罪案件，其中大部分与 TikTok 有关。

Nepali housewife Sushila Pokharel, a regular user of the platform who posts videos of her dancing and singing, said the ban deprives people of a source of recreation.翻译:尼泊尔家庭主妇苏希拉·波卡雷尔（Sushila Pokharel）是该平台的常客，她发布了自己跳舞和唱歌的视频，她表示，这项禁令剥夺了人们的娱乐来源。

"Stop anything bad in it, but it is wrong to ban the app completely," she said.翻译:“停止其中任何不好的事情，但完全禁止该应用程序是错误的，”她说。

Reporting by Gopal Sharma; writing by Shilpa Jamkhandikar; editing by Miral Fahmy翻译:戈帕尔·夏尔马报道；作者：Shilpa Jamkhandikar；米拉尔·法赫米 编辑
item.author: Gopal Sharma

item.title: 中国财富管理公司中植宣布破产，负债640亿美元
item.description:
China's Zhongzhi Enterprise Group, a leading wealth manager, told investors it is heavily insolvent with up to $64 billion in liabilities, threatening to reignite concerns that the country's property debt crisis is spilling over into the broader financial sector.翻译:中国领先的财富管理公司中植企业集团告诉投资者，该公司严重资不抵债，负债高达640亿美元，这可能会再次引发人们对中国房地产债务危机蔓延到更广泛的金融领域的担忧。

The firm, which has sizable exposure to China's real estate sector, apologised to its investors in a letter that said it had total liabilities of about 420 billion yuan ($58 billion) to 460 billion yuan ($64 billion).翻译:该公司在中国房地产行业拥有相当大的敞口，在一封信中向投资者道歉，称其总负债约为人民币 4,​​200 亿元（约合 580 亿美元）至 4,600 亿元（约合 640 亿美元）。

The liabilities compared to Zhongzhi's estimated total assets of about 200 billion yuan, according to the letter, which was issued on Wednesday and was seen by Reuters.翻译:路透看到的周三发布的信函称，这些负债与中植估计的总资产约2000亿元人民币相比。

Beijing-based Zhongzhi did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.翻译:总部位于北京的中植没有立即回应路透社的置评请求。

The worsening woes at Zhongzhi, a major player in China's $3 trillion shadow banking sector - roughly the size of the French economy - is set to rekindle worries about contagion, though some analysts expected regulators to step in to stem a wider fallout.翻译:中植银行是中国规模达3万亿美元的影子银行领域的主要参与者，规模相当于法国经济，其日益恶化的困境将重新引发人们对蔓延的担忧，尽管一些分析师预计监管机构将介入以遏制更广泛的影响。

China's highly indebted property sector has been reeling from a liquidity crunch since 2020. Defaults by developers since late 2021 have impeded economic growth and rattled global markets.翻译:自 2020 年以来，中国负债累累的房地产行业一直受到流动性紧缩的影响。自 2021 年底以来开发商的违约已经阻碍了经济增长，并扰乱了全球市场。

Shadow banking-linked wealth managers in China typically operate outside many of the rules governing commercial banks and mainly channel the proceeds of wealth products sold to retail investors to real estate developers and other sectors.

'ENORMOUS' HOLE

Signs of trouble at the Zhongzhi group first came to light in July when Zhongrong International Trust Co, a leading trust company controlled by Zhongzhi, missed payments on dozens of investment products.翻译:中植集团的麻烦迹象在7月份首次暴露出来，当时中植控股的一家领先信托公司中融国际信托公司拖欠了数十种投资产品的付款。

"The hole in its books is enormous," said Xu, who is an investor in a Zhongrong trust product and gave only her surname due to the sensitivity of the matter. "The firm has been in a mess."翻译:“账目上的漏洞是巨大的，”中融信托产品的投资者徐说，由于此事的敏感性，她只透露了自己的姓氏。 “公司已经一片混乱了。”

Zhongzhi, whose business interests span from mining to wealth management, said in the letter that as the group's assets were concentrated in long-term debt and equity investments it was difficult to liquidate them and book the returns.翻译:业务范围从矿业到财富管理的中植在信中表示，由于该集团的资产集中于长期债务和股权投资，因此难以变现并计入收益。

"Initial inspections show that the group is seriously insolvent and has significant continuing operational risks. The resources available for debt repayment in the short term are much lower than the group's overall debt scale," it said.翻译:初步检查显示，该集团严重资不抵债，存在重大持续经营风险，短期内可用于偿还债务的资源远低于集团整体债务规模。

"The Zhongzhi group deeply apologises for the losses caused to investors. We fully understand the urgency, importance and seriousness of resolving this overall risk," the group said in the letter.

HIGH DEFAULT RISKS

Zhongzhi had hired one of the Big Four accounting firms to conduct an audit of the firm, and was seeking strategic investors, its management told investors in a meeting in August, according to a video seen by Reuters at the time.翻译:根据路透社当时看到的一段视频，中植管理层在 8 月份的一次会议上告诉投资者，中植已聘请四大会计师事务所之一对该公司进行审计，并正在寻找战略投资者。

The underlying assets of Zhongrong trust are largely property related, which have high default risks, said Xing Zhaopeng, senior China strategist at ANZ.翻译:澳新银行高级中国策略师邢兆鹏表示，中融信托的基础资产主要与房地产相关，违约风险较高。

"The company cannot get the money back amid the property woes. So there are big discounts to its assets."翻译:“由于房地产陷入困境，该公司无法收回资金。因此其资产出现了大幅折扣。”

Starting off with timber and real estate trades in the 1990s, Zhongzhi quickly expanded into businesses ranging from chipmaking, healthcare, new energy vehicles and finance, according to its website.翻译:据其网站介绍，中植于20世纪90年代从木材和房地产贸易起步，迅速扩展到芯片制造、医疗保健、新能源汽车和金融等领域。

Its financial businesses include trust, asset management, insurance, futures, and wealth management.翻译:金融业务包括信托、资产管理、保险、期货、财富管理等。

Zhongzhi has been selling stakes in some listed companies it controlled over the past few years, and reducing the size of its business, after coming under pressure in the wake of China's crackdown on shadow banking, and the property market downturn.翻译:在中国打击影子银行和房地产市场低迷等压力下，中植过去几年一直在出售其控制的一些上市公司的股份，并缩小业务规模。

"Financial regulators are almost certain to intervene aggressively if there's any sign that Zhongzhi's troubles are spreading," said Christopher Beddor, deputy director of China research at Gavekal Dragonomics.翻译:“如果有任何迹象表明中植的问题正在蔓延，金融监管机构几乎肯定会大力干预，”龙洲经讯中国研究部副主任克里斯托弗·贝多尔(Christopher Beddor)表示。

He added that the trust industry is only about 5% of the total financial system, so problems there are not necessarily life-threatening.翻译:他补充说，信托业仅占整个金融体系的5%左右，因此出现问题并不一定会危及生命。

Beddor said the chance for investors to get full repayment of their investments is minimal. "Officials could certainly make retail investors whole if they want to, but they'd basically be turning their backs on years of attempts to undermine implicit guarantees. I suspect they won't."翻译:贝多尔表示，投资者获得全额投资回报的机会微乎其微。 “如果官员愿意的话，他们当然可以让散户投资者变得完整，但他们基本上会拒绝多年来破坏隐性担保的尝试。我怀疑他们不会。”

item.title: 日本瑞穗申请在华设立证券公司
item.description:
Japan's Mizuho Financial Group (8411.T) has sought to establish a securities company in China, becoming the latest foreign firm to make inroads into China's onshore securities market with a fully-owned entity.翻译:日本瑞穗金融集团（8411.T）寻求在中国设立证券公司，成为最新一家以全资实体方式进军中国境内证券市场的外资公司。

The China Securities Regulatory Commission has received the application from the securities arm of the third-largest Japanese banking group, according to a filing record issued on Wednesday from the regulator's website.翻译:根据中国证监会网站周三发布的备案记录，中国证监会已收到日本第三大银行集团证券部门的申请。

The application comes as Mizuho is hoping to tap China's lucrative capital markets fee pool, the largest after the United States and Europe.翻译:此次申请之际，瑞穗银行希望利用中国利润丰厚的资本市场费用池，这是仅次于美国和欧洲的最大费用池。

"Mizuho believes that it's necessary to have our securities firm in China to achieve further growth in the key market, where we launched our banking office four decades ago and more than 30,000 Japanese companies are operating," a spokesperson said.翻译:一位发言人表示：“瑞穗认为，我们有必要在中国设立我们的证券公司，以在这个关键市场实现进一步增长。我们四十年前在中国设立了银行办事处，目前有超过 30,000 家日本公司在中国开展业务。”

Citigroup (C.N) and Standard Chartered (STAN.L) are also in the process of establishing securities units in China after Beijing allowed wholly-owned foreign securities companies in 2019.翻译:继北京于 2019 年允许设立独资外资证券公司后，花旗集团(CN)和渣打银行(STAN.L)也正在中国设立证券公司。

Mizuho's larger Japanese rival, Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (8316.T), applied for the launch of a securities unit in 2021, but later withdrew the application due to a market manipulation scandal at its brokerage unit that led to the indictment of former executives last year.翻译:瑞穗较大的日本竞争对手三井住友金融集团（8316.T）曾申请在2021年设立证券部门，但后来由于其经纪部门的市场操纵丑闻导致前高管被起诉而撤回了申请。年。

Reporting by Beijing and Hong Kong newsroom, Makiko Yamazaki in Tokyo; Editing by Jacqueline Wong, Mrigank Dhaniwala and Kim Coghill翻译:北京和香港新闻编辑室 Makiko Yamazaki 驻东京的报道；编辑：Jacqueline Wong、Mrigank Dhaniwala 和 Kim Coghill

item.title: 阿根廷米雷语气柔和地感谢中国国家主席
item.description:
Argentine President-elect Javier Milei on Wednesday thanked Chinese President Xi Jinping for a letter congratulating him on last Sunday's elections results, a softening of tone from earlier harsh criticism of China's communist leadership.翻译:阿根廷候任总统哈维尔·米莱周三感谢中国国家主席习近平致信祝贺他上周日的选举结果，语气较之前对中国共产党领导层的严厉批评有所缓和。

"I thank President Xi Jinping for the congratulations and good wishes," Milei said on his personal X account.翻译:“感谢习近平主席的祝贺和良好祝愿，”米雷在他的个人X账户上表示。

"I send him my most sincere wishes for the Chinese people's wellbeing," he said, sharing a picture of a letter from Xi translated into Spanish.翻译:“我向他致以对中国人民福祉最诚挚的祝愿，”他说，并分享了一张翻译成西班牙语的习近平一封信的照片。

Campaigning for election, Milei, a radical libertarian, had struck a very different tone, suggesting he would balk at doing business with China because of its government's restrictions on individual freedoms.翻译:激进自由主义者米莱在竞选活动中采取了截然不同的语气，表示由于中国政府对个人自由的限制，他将不愿与中国做生意。

China is Argentina's second-largest trade partner, after Brazil.翻译:中国是阿根廷第二大贸易伙伴，仅次于巴西。

China's Xi said in his congratulatory message to the South American leader that he attaches great importance to the development of China-Argentina relations, Chinese state broadcaster CCTV said.翻译:据中国国家电视台中央电视台报道，中国国家主席习近平在给南美领导人的贺电中表示，他高度重视中阿关系的发展。

"I am ready to work with President-elect Milei to continue the China-Argentina friendship, help the development and revitalisation of our respective countries through win-win cooperation, and promote steady and far-reaching development of China-Argentina relations," Xi said in his message to Milei.翻译:我愿同米莱当选总统一道，续写中阿友谊，通过合作共赢助力各自国家发展振兴，推动中阿关系行稳致远。他在给米莱的留言中说道。

Xi added that both countries are large developing countries and important emerging market countries that have firmly supported each other on issues involving their core interests.翻译:习近平表示，两国都是发展中大国和重要新兴市场国家，在涉及彼此核心利益问题上相互坚定支持。

Milei, who will take office on Dec. 10, will inherit a country in economic crisis, with a triple-digit annual inflation, depleted foreign reserves and a poverty rate that has climbed above 40%.翻译:米雷将于12月10日上任，他将继承一个陷入经济危机的国家，该国年通货膨胀率达三位数，外汇储备枯竭，贫困率已攀升至40%以上。

Milei had also criticized the BRICS group of major emerging economies, which includes China, alongside the South American Mercosur trade bloc and neighbor Brazil, the region's largest economy.翻译:米雷还批评了主要新兴经济体金砖国家集团，其中包括中国、 南美南方共同市场贸易集团和该地区最大经济体邻国巴西。

Since the election, Milei has softened his tone with many he has previously criticized, including his countryman Pope Francis.翻译:自选举以来，米莱对他之前批评过的许多人，包括他的同胞教皇方济各，态度都软化了。

In a separate post on Wednesday, Milei thanked former U.S. President Donald Trump for congratulations from his campaign team and said he hoped to meet soon.翻译:在周三的另一篇帖子中，米雷感谢美国前总统唐纳德·特朗普竞选团队的祝贺，并表示他希望很快会面。

item.title: EIG首席执行官表示财团不再愿意与Origin的顶级投资者进行谈判
item.description:
EIG Partners CEO Blair Thomas said on Thursday the consortium behind the $10.6 billion bid for Origin Energy (ORG.AX) was "done" negotiating with top shareholder AustralianSuper in an attempt to gain its backing for the offer.翻译:EIG Partners首席执行官布莱尔·托马斯(Blair Thomas)周四表示，以106亿美元收购Origin Energy (ORG.AX)背后的财团已“完成”与最大股东AustralianSuper的谈判，试图获得其对收购要约的支持。

Thomas said he believed AustralianSuper, which holds 16.5% of Origin, was acting against the best interests of the company's remaining shareholders.翻译:托马斯表示，他认为持有 Origin 16.5% 股份的 AustralianSuper 的行为违背了该公司剩余股东的最佳利益。

EIG is part of the consortium led by Canada's Brookfield.翻译:EIG 是加拿大布鲁克菲尔德公司领导的财团的一部分。

item.title: 日本首相岸田致函中国国家主席习近平 - NHK
item.description:
A Beijing delegation of Komeito, the junior coalition partner of Japan's ruling party, handed a letter from Prime Minister Fumio Kishida for Chinese President Xi Jinping in a meeting with China's top leadership team on Wednesday, NHK reported.翻译:据NHK报道，日本执政党的初级联合伙伴公明党的北京代表团周三在与中国最高领导班子的会晤中，转交了首相岸田文雄致中国国家主席习近平的信函。

The leader of the party, Natsuo Yamaguchi, delivered the letter when he met with Cai Qi, head of the powerful Secretariat of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee that oversees day-to-day affairs of the CPC, according to the Japanese public broadcaster.翻译:据中共中央政治局报道，中共领导人山口那津夫在会见负责中共日常事务的中共中央书记处书记蔡奇时递交了这封信。日本公共广播公司。

The broadcaster did not say what was in the letter. Komeito representatives and Kishida's office were not available to comment on Thursday, a public holiday in Japan.翻译:该广播公司没有透露信中的内容。周四是日本公众假期，公明党代表和岸田办公室未能发表评论。

Yamaguchi and Cai also agreed to work toward a resumption of dialogue between the CPC and the coalition of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) and Komeito, NHK reported. Such talks had been broken off in 2018.翻译:据NHK报道，山口和蔡还同意努力恢复中国共产党与执政的自民党和公明党联盟之间的对话。此类谈判已于 2018 年中断。

The meeting took place as Asia's two largest economies seek to improve ties which have been strained after the neighbours clashed over issues ranging from Japan's release of treated radioactive water into the ocean to maritime territorial claims, China's detention of Japanese citizens, Taiwan and export curbs.翻译:此次会议召开之际，亚洲最大的两个经济体正在寻求改善两国关系。两国关系因日本向海洋排放经过处理的放射性水、海洋领土主张、中国扣押日本公民、台湾问题和出口限制等问题发生冲突而紧张。

Reporting by Makiko Yamazaki; Editing by Stephen Coates翻译:山崎真纪子报道；斯蒂芬·科茨编辑

item.title: Stellantis从中国合资伙伴东风汽车公司回购价值10亿美元的股票
item.description:
Chrysler-parent Stellantis (STLAM.MI) said on Wednesday it has repurchased 50 million common shares from Dongfeng Motor (Hong Kong) International (0489.HK) for about 934 million euros ($1.02 billion).翻译:克莱斯勒母公司Stellantis (STLAM.MI)周三表示，已以约9.34亿欧元（10.2亿美元）从东风汽车（香港）国际（0489.HK）回购5000万股普通股。

Stellantis, which has a joint venture with Dongfeng Motor in China, said it plans to cancel these shares and the transaction with Dongfeng would not impact its 1.5 billion euros open-market repurchase program.翻译:与东风汽车在中国设有合资企业的Stellantis表示，计划注销这些股份，与东风的交易不会影响其15亿欧元的公开市场回购计划。

The program, announced on Feb. 22, is expected to complete by the end of 2023.翻译:该计划于 2 月 22 日宣布，预计将于 2023 年底完成。

Chinese automaker Dongfeng would retain 49.2 million common shares, which represents 1.58% of Stellantis' share capital post-cancellation.翻译:中国汽车制造商东风汽车将保留 4920 万股普通股，占注销后 Stellantis 股本的 1.58%。

item.title: 早间买盘：市场充满节日气氛
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in Asian markets from Lewis Krauskopf, markets correspondent.翻译:市场通讯员刘易斯·克劳斯科普夫 (Lewis Krauskopf) 对亚洲市场未来一天的展望。

Markets were buoyant ahead of Asia trading and the Thanksgiving holiday in the U.S., with stocks resuming their massive rally this month that has been fueled by hopes of a more benign interest rate backdrop.翻译:在亚洲交易和美国感恩节假期之前，市场表现活跃，本月股市恢复大幅上涨，这是由于对更温和的利率背景的希望推动的。

Wall Street's benchmark S&P 500 (.SPX) closed up 0.4%, and was nearing a fresh high for 2023. The S&P 500 and MSCI's all-country index (.MIWD00000PUS) are both up over 8% this month alone, with the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (.IXIC) up 11%.翻译:华尔街基准标准普尔 500指数(.SPX)收盘上涨 0.4%，接近 2023 年新高。仅本月，标准普尔 500 指数和 MSCI 全国指数(.MIWD00000PUS)均上涨超过 8%，其中科技股纳斯达克综合指数(.IXIC)上涨 11%。

Markets were still digesting minutes from the Federal Reserve's latest meeting, which revealed that central bank officials agreed they would proceed carefully and only raise interest rates if progress in controlling inflation faltered.翻译:市场仍在消化美联储最新会议纪要，会议纪要显示，央行官员同意，他们将谨慎行事，只有在控制通胀进展缓慢的情况下才会加息。

Indeed, many investors now seem confident the Fed may be done raising rates for this cycle, and are eyeing the middle of next year for when the central bank may start to make cuts.翻译:事实上，许多投资者现在似乎对美联储可能完成本周期加息充满信心，并期待明年中期央行可能开始降息。

Even Nvidia's (NVDA.O) selloff following its results couldn't dampen Wednesday's mood. After soaring well over 200% this year, Nvidia shares ended down 2.5% on Wednesday amid fears that widening U.S. chip curbs would sap growth in China.翻译:即使英伟达(NVDA.O) 在公布业绩后遭遇抛售，也未能抑制周三的情绪。在今年飙升超过 200% 后， 英伟达股价周三收盘下跌2.5%，原因是担心美国扩大芯片限制将削弱中国的增长。

Aside from Nvidia, other members of the Magnificent Seven megacap group rallied on Wednesday, with Amazon (AMZN.O) gaining nearly 2% and Alphabet (GOOGL.O) and Microsoft (MSFT.O) up over 1%.翻译:除英伟达外，七巨头集团的其他成员周三也纷纷上涨，其中亚马逊(AMZN.O)上涨近 2%，Alphabet (GOOGL.O)和微软(MSFT.O)上涨超过 1%。

A Reuters poll of stock market experts found most key global stock indexes are forecast to rise modestly over the coming year.翻译:路透社对股市专家的一项调查发现，预计全球大多数主要股指在未来一年将小幅上涨。

Japanese markets were also set to be closed for a national holiday on Thursday. On Wednesday, the Nikkei .N225 edged up 0.3%, putting the Japanese index near a fresh three-decade high.翻译:日本市场周四也因国定假日休市。周三，日经指数.N225小幅上涨0.3% ，使日本指数接近三年来的新高。

Also in Wednesday's session, China stocks slid as market participants awaited more stimulus for the Chinese economy. The blue-chip CSI 300 Index (.CSI300) sank 1%.翻译:同样在周三的交易中，由于市场参与者等待中国经济出台更多刺激措施，中国股市下跌。蓝筹股沪深300指数（.CSI300）下跌1%。

Reuters reported that Chinese government advisers will recommend economic growth targets for next year ranging from 4.5% to 5.5% to an annual policymakers' meeting, as Beijing seeks to create jobs and keep long-term development goals on track.翻译:路透社报道称，中国政府顾问将向年度政策制定者会议推荐明年4.5%至5.5% 的经济增长目标，因为北京寻求创造就业机会并保持长期发展目标步入正轨。

Meanwhile, the dollar index rose, bouncing back from a 2-1/2 month low. Economic data showed the number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits fell more than expected last week.翻译:与此同时， 美元指数上涨，从2-1/2个月低点反弹。 经济数据显示，上周美国初请失业金人数降幅超过预期。

The yen weakened on Wednesday, trading at around 150 per dollar. While speculation that the Bank of Japan could exit from negative interest rates early next year stands to help stabilize the yen, the Japanese currency still faces strong headwinds.翻译:周三日元走软，交易价格为 1 美元兑 150 日元左右。尽管有关日本央行可能于明年初退出负利率的猜测有助于稳定日元，但日元仍面临强劲阻力。

Oil prices dropped as OPEC+ producers unexpectedly delayed a meeting on production cuts.翻译:由于OPEC+产油国意外推迟减产会议， 油价下跌。

Trading volumes were set to be subdued for the rest of the week with markets in the U.S. closed on Thursday.翻译:由于美国市场周四休市，本周剩余时间交易量预计将低迷。

Here are key developments that could provide more direction to markets on Thursday:翻译:以下是周四可能为市场提供更多方向的关键进展：

item.title: 由于对中国的担忧掩盖了出色的预测，英伟达股价下跌
item.description:
Nvidia (NVDA.O) shares fell nearly 4% on Wednesday on fears that widening U.S. chip curbs would sap growth in China, its third largest market, and curtail the AI-driven boom in its business.翻译:英伟达(NVDA.O)股价周三下跌近 4%，原因是担心美国扩大芯片限制将削弱其第三大市场中国的增长，并抑制人工智能驱动的业务繁荣。

The company was set to erase more than $40 billion in market capitalization if losses hold, based on its current share price of $482.20.翻译:根据目前 482.20 美元的股价，如果亏损持续下去，该公司将损失超过 400 亿美元的市值。

Nvidia, which has been at the forefront of artificial intelligence developments with its tailor-made graphics processing units, said its China business will take a hit from tighter export controls.翻译:凭借其定制的图形处理单元一直处于人工智能发展前沿的英伟达表示，其中国业务将受到更严格的出口管制的打击。

Still, it forecast current-quarter revenue of $20 billion, plus or minus 2%, beating analysts' average estimate by more than $2 billion, according to LSEG data.翻译:不过，根据 LSEG 的数据，该公司预计本季度营收为 200 亿美元，上下浮动 2%，比分析师平均预期高出 20 亿美元以上。

China contributed more than a fifth of its total revenue in the quarter ended Oct. 29.翻译:截至 10 月 29 日的季度，中国贡献了其总收入的五分之一以上。

"This disconnect between stellar earnings and an uncertain future in China is causing investor concern," said Scott Acheychek, CEO of REX Shares, which offers a fund linked to Nvidia shares.翻译:REX Shares 首席执行官 Scott Aceychek 表示：“中国出色的盈利与不确定的未来之间的脱节正在引起投资者的担忧。”该公司提供与 Nvidia 股票挂钩的基金。

Nvidia has been one of the biggest beneficiaries of a rally in AI-linked stocks, with its shares gaining 229.8% compared to tech-heavy Nasdaq's (.IXIC) 36.6% rise so far this year.翻译:英伟达是人工智能相关股票上涨的最大受益者之一，其股价上涨了 229.8%，而以科技股为主的纳斯达克指数(.IXIC)今年迄今为止上涨了 36.6%。

"Nvidia's shares went into the results 'priced to perfection'....compounded by a run-up to record highs going into the release," said Capital.com analyst Kyle Rodda.翻译:Capital.com 分析师凯尔·罗达 (Kyle Rodda) 表示：“英伟达的股价进入了业绩‘定价完美’的阶段……此外，业绩发布后股价还创下历史新高。”

"As a result, despite fantastic financial performance and an even better outlook than analysts had been expecting, any bad news was bound to undermine sentiment."翻译:“因此，尽管财务业绩出色，前景比分析师预期还要好，但任何坏消息都必然会损害市场情绪。”

At least seven brokerages raised their target price for the stock with the median now at $625, more than $125 above its last closing price, signaling confidence that the business would grow as businesses adopt AI.翻译:至少有 7 家券商上调了该股的目标价，目前中位价为 625 美元，比上次收盘价高出 125 美元以上，表明人们有信心随着企业采用人工智能，该业务将会增长。

"Looking further out, NVDA continues to expect Data Center segment growth in 2025 and has plans to increase supply on a quarterly basis," brokerage Stifel said in note.翻译:券商 Stifel 在报告中表示：“展望未来，NVDA 继续预计数据中心细分市场将在 2025 年实现增长，并计划按季度增加供应。”

item.title: 日本政党访问中国以修复紧张关系
item.description:
The junior coalition partner of Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) has sent a delegation to Beijing to meet with China's top leadership team as Asia's two largest economies seek to improve strained ties.翻译:日本执政党自民党的初级联盟伙伴已派出代表团前往北京与中国最高领导团队会面，亚洲两大经济体寻求改善紧张关系。

A Komeito party delegation led by the leader of the party Natsuo Yamaguchi on Wednesday met with Cai Qi, head of the powerful Secretariat of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee that oversees day-to-day affairs of the CPC.翻译:周三，由党魁山口那津夫率领的公明党代表团会见了负责中共日常事务的中共中央书记处书记蔡奇。

The ruling parties of both countries should "accurately grasp each other's development and strategic intentions," Chinese state media quoted Cai as telling the Japanese delegation.翻译:中国官方媒体援引蔡对日本代表团的话说，两国执政党应“准确把握对方的发展和战略意图”。

Both sides should work together to promote "positive" and "friendly" mutual understanding, added Cai, also the fifth-ranked member of the CPC's seven-person Politburo Standing Committee, the highest tier of political power in China helmed by President Xi Jinping.翻译:蔡补充道，双方应共同努力促进“积极”和“友好”的相互了解。他也是中国共产党七人政治局常务委员会的第五位成员，这是由习近平主席领导的中国最高政治权力机构。

The visit came on the heels of rare face-to-face talks between Xi and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, also LDP's leader, on the sidelines of an Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in the United States last week during which both sides affirmed their strategic relationship.翻译:此次访问之前，习近平上周在美国举行的亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会期间与日本首相、自民党领袖岸田文雄进行了罕见的面对面会谈。肯定了双方的战略关系。

Bilateral ties have become strained after the neighbours clashed over issues from Japan's release of treated radioactive water into the ocean to maritime territorial claims, detention of Japanese citizens, Taiwan and export curbs.翻译:邻国在日本向海洋排放经过处理的放射性水、海洋领土主张、 拘留日本公民、台湾和出口限制等问题上发生冲突后，双边关系变得紧张。

In a survey of Japanese firms with operations in China released on Tuesday, the number of companies planning to expand in the country fell below 30% for the first time in a reflection of the fraught ties.翻译:周二公布的一项针对在中国开展业务的日本企业的调查显示，计划在中国扩张的企业数量首次降至 30% 以下，反映出中日关系的紧张。

Wednesday's meeting also touched on the discharge of the radioactive water. Despite China's repeated protests, Japan started dumping water from its crippled Fukushima nuclear plant in late August, swiftly prompting a Chinese ban on Japanese seafood imports and the postponement of Yamaguchi's visit.翻译:周三的会议还讨论了放射性水的排放问题。尽管中国一再抗议，日本还是于八月下旬开始从受损的福岛核电站倾倒水，迅速促使中国禁止进口日本海鲜，并推迟了山口的访问。

Yamaguchi's two-day visit this week, originally scheduled for end-August, is expected to set the stage for a resumption of dialogue between the LDP-Komeito coalition and the CPC, after both sides broke off talks in 2018.翻译:山口原定于 8 月底进行为期两天的访问，预计将为自民党-公明党联盟与中国共产党在 2018 年中断谈判后恢复对话奠定基础。

Reporting by Ryan Woo; editing by Jason Neely, Alexandra Hudson翻译:瑞恩·吴 (Ryan Woo) 报道；编辑：杰森·尼利、亚历山德拉·哈德森
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 中国航空监管机构负责人与美国大使寻求增加航班
item.description:
The head of China's civil aviation regulator, Song Zhiyong, met with the U.S. Ambassador in Beijing Nicholas Burns, and exchanged views on pushing for a substantial increase in flights between the two countries, the regulator said on Wednesday.翻译:中国民航局局长宋志勇周三会见了美国驻北京大使尼古拉斯·伯恩斯，就推动两国间航班大幅增加交换了意见。

The Civil Aviation Administration of China (CAAC) welcomes U.S. aviation-related enterprises to operate and develop in China, Song said.翻译:宋说，中国民航局欢迎美国航空相关企业来华经营发展。

Back in August, the United States and China said they would approve twice the number of passenger flights currently permitted for air carriers to fly between the two countries.翻译:早在八月，美国和中国就表示，他们将批准两倍于目前允许航空公司在两国之间飞行的客运航班数量。

In his speech at a reception, Song said the two countries should continue the vision that President Xi Jinping and U.S. President Joe Biden laid out in their recent meeting at APEC and create a new situation for China-U.S. civil aviation cooperation in the future.翻译:宋在招待会上致辞时表示，两国要继承习近平主席和拜登在亚太经合组织会议上提出的愿景，开创未来中美民航合作的新局面。

Song and Burns expounded on those talks, saying they both want to strengthen cooperation in various fields of civil aviation between China and the U.S., according to a statement.翻译:声明称，宋和伯恩斯对会谈进行了阐述，表示双方都希望加强中美民航各领域的合作。

"CAAC welcomes American aviation-related enterprises to operate and develop in China and jointly create a better future for the global aviation industry," Song said.翻译:宋说：“中国民航局欢迎美国航空相关企业来华经营发展，共同创造全球航空业更加美好的未来。”

Both want China and the U.S. to further increase flights by a large margin, Song said, as relations between the two countries show signs of thawing after months of tensions over several global issues.翻译:宋说，双方都希望中美两国进一步大幅增加航班，因为在几个全球问题上的紧张局势持续数月后，两国关系出现解冻迹象。

Reporting by Bernard Orr and Ethan Wang Editing by Jason Neely and Mark Potter翻译:伯纳德·奥尔和伊森·王报道 杰森·尼利和马克·波特编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 台湾报道选举活动升温之际附近有中国战斗机和轰炸机
item.description:
Taiwan again reported Chinese military activity around the island on Wednesday, with 11 aircraft crossing the sensitive median line of the Taiwan Strait as the island's election campaign kicked into high gear.翻译:周三，台湾再次报道中国在台湾周边的军事活动，随着台湾选举活动进入高潮，有 11 架飞机飞越敏感的台湾海峡中线。

Democratically-governed Taiwan, which China claims as its own territory, has complained for the past four years of regular Chinese military patrols and drills near the island, as Beijing seeks to pressure Taipei over its sovereignty claims.翻译:中国声称拥有民主统治的台湾是其自己的领土，过去四年来，中国在该岛附近定期进行军事巡逻和演习，对中国的定期军事巡逻和演习表示不满，因为北京试图就其主权主张向台北施压。

Taiwan holds presidential and parliamentary polls on Jan. 13 and candidates have to register with the election commission this week in order to take part.翻译:台湾将于1月13日举行总统和议会选举，候选人必须在本周向选举委员会登记才能参加。

The ruling Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), which Beijing views as separatists, registered its presidential ticket on Tuesday, though the opposition is mired in disagreement about a potential joint bid.翻译:被北京视为分裂分子的执政党民进党于周二登记了总统候选人名单，尽管反对派对联合竞选存在分歧。

Taiwan's defence ministry said that starting early Wednesday afternoon it had detected J-10 and J-16 fighters as well as H-6 bombers and early warning aircraft carrying out overseas missions.翻译:台湾国防部表示，从周三下午开始，它发现了执行海外任务的歼10和歼16战斗机以及轰6轰炸机和预警机。

Eleven of those aircraft crossed the Taiwan Strait's median line flying in airspace to the centre and southwest of the island, working with Chinese warships to carry out "joint combat readiness patrols", the ministry added.翻译:国防部补充说，其中11架飞机越过台湾海峡中线，飞往台湾中部和西南部空域，与中国军舰一起进行“联合战备巡逻”。

The strait's median line had previously served as an unofficial barrier between the two sides and which Chinese planes now regularly fly over.翻译:海峡中线此前曾是两岸之间的非正式屏障，现在中国飞机经常飞越该海峡。

Taiwan sent its own forces to monitor, the ministry said.翻译:国防部表示，台湾派出自己的部队进行监视。

China's defence ministry did not answer calls seeking comment. China says its activities near Taiwan are aimed at preventing "collusion" between Taiwan separatists and the United States and to protect China's territorial integrity.翻译:中国国防部没有回复寻求置评的电话。中国表示，其在台湾附近的活动旨在防止台湾分裂分子与美国“勾结”，保护中国的领土完整。

Taiwan's government, which has repeatedly offered talks with China, rejects Beijing's sovereignty claims and says only the island's people can decide their future.翻译:台湾政府多次提出与中国进行谈判，拒绝北京的主权主张，并表示只有台湾人民才能决定他们的未来。

Taiwan's main opposition party, the Kuomintang, traditionally supports close ties with Beijing, and has pledged to re-open dialogue with China should it win the election.翻译:台湾主要反对党国民党历来支持与北京的密切关系，并承诺如果赢得选举，将与中国重新开启对话。

Reporting by Ben Blanchard; Editing by Toby Chopra and Raju Gopalakrishnan翻译:本·布兰查德报道；托比·乔普拉 (Toby Chopra) 和拉朱·戈帕拉克里希南 (Raju Gopalakrishnan) 编辑

item.title: 独家：中国任命金融资深人士朱先生为新任外汇主管 - 消息人士
item.description:
China is set to appoint Zhu Hexin, a veteran banker and chief of state-run financial conglomerate CITIC Group, as the new head of its foreign exchange regulator, four people familiar with the matter said, amid growing headwinds for the economy and markets.翻译:四位知情人士表示，在经济和市场面临的阻力日益加大的情况下，中国将任命资深银行家、国有金融集团中信集团首席执行官朱鹤新为外汇监管机构新任负责人。

Zhu's appointment to lead the State Administration of Foreign Exchange (SAFE) is expected to be announced as soon as this week, said one of the sources.翻译:一位消息人士称，朱镕基领导国家外汇管理局的任命预计最快将于本周宣布。

Zhu, 55, would also be named a deputy governor of the People's Bank of China (PBOC), which oversees the foreign exchange regulator, said the source.翻译:消息人士称，55 岁的朱还将被任命为中国人民银行 (PBOC) 副行长，负责监管外汇监管机构。

Three sources said that the ruling Chinese Communist Party's so-called central organisation department conducted suitability checks on Zhu last week, a practice followed for all high-profile government appointments in the country.翻译:三名消息人士称，执政的中国共产党所谓的中央组织部上周对朱朱进行了适合性审查，这是该国所有高调政府任命所遵循的做法。

Representatives at the PBOC, SAFE, and CITIC (CITIC.UL) did not immediately respond to Reuters' requests for comment. Reuters was not able to reach the party's central organisation department and Zhu for comment.翻译:中国人民银行、国家外汇管理局和中信银行 (CITIC.UL) 的代表没有立即回应路透社的置评请求。路透社未能联系到中共中央组织部和朱朱置评。

All the sources did not wish to be named as they were not authorised to speak to the media.翻译:所有消息人士均不愿透露姓名，因为他们无权接受媒体采访。

Zhu's appointment as the head of SAFE will come at a time when the world's second-largest economy is struggling to boost growth, fend off risk of financial instability, and stabilise the currency to stem capital outflows.翻译:朱镕基被任命为国家外汇管理局局长之际，正值世界第二大经济体努力提振增长、抵御金融不稳定风险、稳定货币以遏制资本外流。

A severe downturn in the property sector, which accounts for about a quarter of economic activity in China, and a mountain of local government debt also pose major challenges for the banking sector and the broader economy.翻译:占中国经济活动约四分之一的房地产行业严重下滑，加上地方政府债务堆积如山，也给银行业和整体经济带来了重大挑战。

Zhu will take over the forex regulatory head role from Pan Gongsheng, who has held the post since 2016 and who was named the central bank governor in July. Zhu was also a contender for the PBOC governor role, Reuters and other media had reported.翻译:朱将从潘功胜手中接过外汇监管负责人的职务，潘功胜自2016年起担任该职务，并于7月被任命为央行行长。据路透社和其他媒体报道，朱也是中国人民银行行长一职的竞争者。

In a sign of his rising status within the government, Zhu was named an alternate member of the Communist Party's Central Committee, the largest of the party's top decision-making bodies, in 2022.翻译:2022年，朱被任命为共产党中央委员会候补委员，这是共产党最大的最高决策机构，这标志着他在政府中的地位不断上升。

He previously held senior posts at state lenders Bank of Communications (601328.SS) and Bank of China (601988.SS).翻译:他此前曾在国有银行交通银行（601328.SS）和中国银行（601988.SS）担任高级职务。

An engineering graduate from the Shanghai University of Finance and Economics, Zhu has also been a deputy central bank governor, and vice governor of Sichuan province in southwestern China.

FORMIDABLE CHALLENGES

In the near term, Zhu's challenges appear formidable.翻译:短期内，朱的挑战显得十分艰巨。

Chinese government advisers will recommend growth targets for next year ranging from 4.5% to 5.5% to a policymakers' meeting, as Beijing seeks to create jobs and keep long-term development goals on track, Reuters reported on Wednesday.翻译:据路透社周三报道，中国政府顾问将向政策制定者会议推荐明年 4.5% 至 5.5% 的增长目标，因为北京方面寻求创造就业机会并保持长期发展目标步入正轨。

China's yuan has lost nearly 3.5% against the dollar so far this year, but peak pessimism may have passed as the yuan firmed 2% in the past week amid a weak U.S. dollar and persistently strong yuan midpoint fixings .翻译:今年迄今为止，人民币兑美元汇率已下跌近3.5%，但悲观情绪的顶峰可能已经过去，在美元疲软和人民币中间价持续走强的情况下，人民币在过去一周坚挺了2%。

The PBOC, which delivered modest interest rate cuts and has pumped more cash into the economy in recent weeks, is constrained in how much it can ease monetary policy for fear of stoking capital flight and hurting the yuan, analysts have said.翻译:分析师表示，中国央行最近几周小幅降息并向经济注入了更多现金，但由于担心引发资本外逃并损害人民币汇率，其放松货币政策的力度受到限制。

Capital outflows from China rose sharply to $75 billion in September, the biggest monthly figure since 2016, Goldman Sachs' preferred gauge of foreign exchange flows showed, underscoring intensifying depreciation pressure on the yuan.翻译:高盛首选的外汇流动指标显示，9月份中国资本外流大幅增至750亿美元，为2016年以来最大月度数字，突显人民币贬值压力加剧。

China's foreign exchange reserves - the world's largest – fell by $26.47 billion in the first 10 months of this year to $3.1 trillion.翻译:中国的外汇储备位居世界第一，今年前10个月减少了264.7亿美元，至3.1万亿美元。

Last month, Chinese President Xi Jinping made his first known visit to the offices of PBOC and SAFE in Beijing since he became president a decade ago, Reuters reported, citing sources, amid mounting economic challenges.翻译:路透社援引消息人士的话报道，上个月，在经济挑战日益严峻的情况下，中国国家主席习近平自十年前就任国家主席以来首次访问了中国人民银行和国家外汇管理局在北京的办公室。

Zhu will take up his new role against the backdrop of other changes in China's regulatory system this year.翻译:朱先生将在今年中国监管体系发生其他变化的背景下履新。

The changes include setting up of a new national financial regulatory administration replacing the existing banking and insurance watchdog, and the unveiling of a super regulator, Central Financial Commission (CFC), with Premier Li Qiang as its head.翻译:这些变化包括设立一个新的国家金融监管机构，取代现有的银行和保险监管机构，以及设立一个超级监管机构——中央金融委员会（CFC），由李强总理担任主席。

Reporting by Beijing and Hong Kong newsrooms; Editing by Sumeet Chatterjee and Muralikumar Anantharaman翻译:北京和香港新闻编辑室的报道；编辑：Sumeet Chatterjee 和 Muralikumar Anantharaman
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 独家：中国政府顾问呼吁2024年稳增长目标，加大刺激力度
item.description:
Summary:
  • Govt advisers to recommend 2024 growth targets of 4.5-5.5%
  • China to rely on fiscal spending to drive growth next year
  • PBOC may play supporting role with modest policy easing
翻译:概括：
  • 政府顾问建议 2024 年增长目标为 4.5-5.5%
  • 中国明年将依靠财政支出拉动经济增长
  • 央行可能通过适度宽松政策发挥支持作用

Chinese government advisers will recommend economic growth targets for next year ranging from 4.5% to 5.5% to an annual policymakers' meeting, as Beijing seeks to create jobs and keep long-term development goals on track.翻译:中国政府顾问将向年度决策者会议推荐明年4.5%至5.5%的经济增长目标，因为北京寻求创造就业机会并保持长期发展目标步入正轨。

Five of the seven advisers who spoke with Reuters said they favoured a target of around 5%, matching this year's goal. One adviser will propose a 4.5% target, while the other suggested a 5.0-5.5% range.翻译:接受路透社采访的七名顾问中有五名表示，他们赞成将目标定为 5% 左右，与今年的目标相符。一位顾问将提出 4.5% 的目标，而另一位顾问则建议 5.0-5.5% 的范围。

The proposals will be made next month at the ruling Communist Party's annual Central Economic Work Conference that discusses policy plans and the outlook for the world's second-largest economy.翻译:这些建议将于下个月在执政的共产党年度中央经济工作会议上提出，会议将讨论世界第二大经济体的政策计划和前景。

Reaching such targets would require Beijing to step up fiscal stimulus, the advisers said, given that this year's growth has been flattered by last year's low-base effect of COVID-19 lockdowns.翻译:顾问们表示，要实现这些目标，北京需要加大财政刺激力度，因为今年的经济增长因去年新冠病毒 (COVID-19) 封锁的低基数效应而受到影响。

"We need to adopt expansionary fiscal and monetary policy to stimulate aggregate demand," Yu Yongding, a government economist who advocates for a growth target of roughly 5%, told Reuters.翻译:“我们需要采取扩张性财政和货币政策来刺激总需求，”主张5%左右增长目标的政府经济学家余永定对路透社表示。

"Corporate investment demand will not be strong as the confidence of companies has not recovered, so we need to expand infrastructure investment," added Yu, who also favours a budget deficit topping 4% of economic output.翻译:于补充说：“由于企业信心尚未恢复，企业投资需求不会强劲，因此我们需要扩大基础设施投资。”他还支持预算赤字占经济产出的4％以上。

The other advisers spoke on condition of anonymity due to the closed-door nature of the discussions. Top leaders are expected to endorse the target at the December meeting, although it will not be announced publicly until China's annual parliament meeting, usually held in March.翻译:由于讨论是闭门性质的，其他顾问都要求匿名。预计最高领导人将在 12 月的会议上批准这一目标，不过要到通常在 3 月份举行的中国年度人大会议才会公开宣布这一目标。

In October, China unveiled a plan to issue 1 trillion yuan ($139 billion) in sovereign bonds by the end of the year, raising the 2023 budget deficit target to 3.8% of gross domestic product (GDP) from the original 3%.翻译:10月，中国公布了在年底前发行1万亿元人民币（1,390亿美元）主权债券的计划，将2023年预算赤字目标从原来占国内生产总值（GDP）的3%提高到3.8%。

Chinese leaders have pledged to "optimize the structure of central and local government debt", suggesting the central government has room to spend more as its debt as a share of GDP is just 21%, far lower than 76% for local governments.翻译:中国领导人承诺“优化中央和地方政府债务结构”，这表明中央政府有增加支出的空间，因为其债务占GDP的比重仅为21%，远低于地方政府的76%。

"We are stepping up fiscal policy support," said another adviser, to make the "difficult" 2024 target "achievable."翻译:另一位顾问表示：“我们正在加大财政政策支持力度，以使 2024 年“困难的”目标“能够实现”。

Monetary stimulus is expected to play a more limited role as the central bank remains concerned a widening interest rate differential with the West may further weaken the yuan and encourage capital outflows.翻译:由于央行仍担心与西方利差扩大可能进一步压低人民币并鼓励资本外流，预计货币刺激措施的作用将更加有限。

"The space for monetary policy could be bigger if we have greater tolerance for exchange rate fluctuations," said Guan Tao, global chief economist at BOC International and a former official at the State Administration of Foreign Exchange (SAFE).

REFORMS VS STIMULUS

China’s economy grew only 3% in 2022, one of its worst performances in nearly half a century. A Reuters poll in October showed that economists expect it to grow 5.0% in 2023 and 4.5% in 2024, although some have since raised their forecasts.翻译:2022年中国经济仅增长3%，是近半个世纪以来最糟糕的表现之一。路透社 10 月份的一项民意调查显示，经济学家预计 2023 年将增长 5.0%，2024 年将增长 4.5%，尽管此后有些人提高了预测。

In 2022, President Xi Jinping laid out a long-term vision of "Chinese-style modernisation" at a key party meeting, with a goal of doubling China's economy by 2035 that government economists say would require average annual growth of 4.7%.翻译:2022年，国家主席习近平在一次重要的党内会议上提出了“中国式现代化”的长期愿景，目标是到2035年使中国经济翻一番，政府经济学家称这需要年均增长4.7%。

The stuttering post-COVID recovery has prompted many analysts to call for structural reforms that tilt the drivers of economic growth away from property and infrastructure investment and towards household consumption and market-allocation of resources.翻译:新冠疫情后的缓慢复苏促使许多分析师呼吁进行结构性改革，将经济增长的驱动力从房地产和基础设施投资转向家庭消费和资源的市场配置。

Absent that, these economists warn, China may begin flirting with Japan-style stagnation later this decade.翻译:这些经济学家警告说，如果没有这一点，中国可能会在本十年晚些时候开始陷入日本式的停滞。

Beijing has been trying to reduce economic reliance on property, channelling more resources into high-tech manufacturing and green industries, but has struggled to boost consumer and investor sentiment.翻译:北京一直在努力减少经济对房地产的依赖，将更多资源投入高科技制造业和绿色产业，但一直难以提振消费者和投资者情绪。

Policy insiders believe more fundamental changes, especially a revival of market-oriented reforms, are unlikely due to the political environment, under which the state has increased its control over the economy, including the private sector.翻译:政策人士认为，由于政治环境的影响，国家加强了对经济（包括私营部门）的控制，不太可能出现更根本的变化，特别是恢复市场导向的改革。

"If there is no consensus on reforms, we will have to use stimulus to drive growth, even though it will not be sustainable,” a third adviser said.翻译:第三位顾问表示：“如果不能就改革达成共识，我们将不得不利用刺激措施来推动增长，尽管这不可持续。”
